page.title: 18Going to Church.
page.content: {St. John's Church,}Pensilva was built in{1899}using money left in the will of Archdeacon Hobhouse, Rector of St. Ive. The mother church of St. Ive is two miles away, and the building of St. John's meant that the people of Pensilva now had their own place of worship. The church is unusual in that it is a sectional building of timber and corrugated iron, with a stone base and porch. Inside it is beautifully panelled in pine. It was purchased in London for Â£198 and brought to Pensilva by railway and then by wagon and horses. The{Methodist Church}in Pensilva was built in{1861.}It is a large building with a Sunday Schoolroom at the back. Two services are held each Sunday, morning and evening, and the Sunday School meets at 1100 hrs. {Tina Doreen Furse. Samantha Jane Sams.
